alert.note: Alert for Pinellas (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 16 at 8:06PM EDT until further notice by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Florida, including the following county, Pinellas. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 806 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clearwater, Largo, Pinellas Park, Seminole, St. Petersburg, St. Pete Beach, South Highpoint, West And East Lealman, Bay Pines, Feather Sound, Ridgecrest, Harbor Bluffs, Gandy, Gulfport, Treasure Island, Kenneth City, South Pasadena, Madeira Beach, Belleair and Redington Shores. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
